Identification.LongTitle: Use of the Word “Bank” by Non-financial Businesses (Excluded Entities) Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to section 983(16)a of the Bank Actb, hereby makes the annexed Name Use by Non-financial Businesses (Excluded Entities) Regulations.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Bank Act.
For the purpose of subsection 983(5.1) of the Act, the following entities are prescribed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an entity in which a bank has a substantial investment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an entity that is affiliated with a bank or a bank holding company;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an entity in which a bank holding company has a substantial investment;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an entity associated with a foreign bank;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: an entity in which a foreign bank has a substantial investment;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: an entity in which an entity associated with a foreign bank has a substantial investment;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: an entity that has a substantial investment in a bank or a bank holding company; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: an entity that is affiliated with an entity that has a substantial investment in a bank or a bank holding company.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which subsection 983(2) of the Bank Act, as enacted by section 183 of the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada Act, chapter 9 of the Statutes of Canada, 2001, comes into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force October 24, 2001, see SI/2001-102.]
